LightningComponentBundle.description: Improving the standard File Upload component.

property.name: label
property.description: The text on the file upload button.
property.label: File Upload Label

property.name: uploadedlabel
property.description: The text on the list of files uploaded. You might find that you prefer to leave this blank, as the UX is obvious.
property.label: Uploaded File List Label

property.name: acceptedFormats
property.description: The accepted file types. Enter a comma-separated list of the file extensions (such as .jpg) that the user can upload.
property.label: Accepted Formats

property.name: allowMultiple
property.description: Allow the user to upload multiple files. If this is not TRUE, then once the user uploads one file, the file upload component will not allow any additional files to be uploaded.
property.label: Allow Multiple Files

property.name: sessionKey
property.description: Unique identifier for this field. You can start by using {!$Flow.InterviewGuid}. If you have multiple of this component type in the same flow, you'll have to prepend {!$Flow.InterviewGuid} with something else like '1' or '2' to make each component unique.
property.label: {!$Flow.InterviewGuid}

property.name: contentDocumentIds
property.description: The Ids of the uploaded files. Store this value in a text collection variable. Content Document Ids are hidden from community users, so the collection will be null for them.
property.label: Content Document Ids

property.name: contentVersionIds
property.description: The Version Ids of the uploaded files. Store this value in a text collection variable.
property.label: Content Version Ids

property.name: recordId
property.description: The Id of the record to associate the files with. Be aware that sharing rules are NOT enforced, so the user could be uploading files to a record that they wouldn't normally have access to.
property.label: Related Record Id

property.name: uploadedFileNames
property.description: The names of the uploaded files. Store this value in a text collection variable.
property.label: Uploaded File Names

property.name: required
property.description: Require the user to upload at least one file.
property.label: Required

property.name: requiredMessage
property.description: The validation message displayed if the user has not uploaded at least one file. The default message is 'Upload at least one file.'
property.label: Required Validation Message

property.name: icon
property.description: The default LDS Icon that will be displayed next to each uploaded file. Options here: https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/icons/#doctype. Prepend icon name with 'doctype:', ie 'doctype:word'. Leave blank and the system will display the icon based on the extension type.
property.label: Icon

property.name: community
property.description: This input is deprecated. Any value set here will no longer impact the function of the component.
property.label: Deprecated

property.name: overriddenFileName
property.description: The file name of the uploaded files defaults to the actual name of the file. If you'd prefer to override the default file name, you can specify the new file name here.
property.label: Overridden File Name

property.name: renderExistingFiles
property.description: If you'd like to show the existing files associated with the Related Record Id (in addition to the ones that the user may upload), set this to TRUE. Be aware that sharing rules are NOT enforced, so the user could see files that they wouldn't normally have access to.
property.label: Show Existing Files Related to Record Id

property.name: renderFilesBelow
property.description: By default, the files will show above the File Upload Component. If you'd prefer they be shown below the component, set this to TRUE.
property.label: Show Files Below the File Upload Component

property.name: visibleToAllUsers
property.description: By default, when an internal user uploads a file, the file is only visible to other internal users (meaning community users can't see it). If you'd like to make the uploaded file visible to all users, set this to TRUE. When a community user uploads a file, the file is already visible to all users.
property.label: Set Visibility to All Users
